// Financial assistance for disabled person
Financial Assistance for disabled person Visually impaired, hearing impaired, orthopedically handicapped Assistance for purchase of appliances to disabled persons as per their age group and disability she will get married incentive 1. Monthly income off the applicant should be less than ₹1500 2. Applicant should have minimum 40% disability 3. Applicant should be domicile in Maharashtra
1. Crutches 2. Tricycle 3. Callipers 4. Wheelchair
Application in prescribed form attach with necessary documents.
Domicile Certificate,Proof of identity
// Financial Assistance to Self-Employment for Trained Disabled Persons Visually handicapped, Low vision, hearing impaired, and orthopedically handicapped
Financial assistance to facilitate purchase of equipment for those disable persons who are completing vocational training from government institutions or recognize institution to start their own business 1.Application in prescribed format submitted to concern District Social Welfare Office, Zillah Parishad and Assistant Commissioner Social Welfare Office ,Mumbai Urban and Mumbai Suburban 2.Applicant must completed their vocational training in Government or Government recognized institution 3.Applicant should have minimum 40% disability. 3.Applicant should be Domicile in Maharashtra. 4.Applicant should submit their proposal with proposed project cost.
The State Government of Maharashtra has provided financial assistance of Rs. 1000/- for purchase of total kits/ equipments to start their own business .
Application in prescribed format attached with necessary documents
Proof of Disability,Domicile Certificate
// Divyangjan Swavalamban Yojana : Divyangjan Swavalamban Yojana NHFDC provides financial assistance in terms of loan to Persons with Disabilities for starting any activity contributing directly or indirectly in the income generation or helping PwD in their overall process of empowerment through implementing agencies throughout the country including West Bengal.
The main objective of the Scheme is to assist the needy disabled persons by providing concessional loan for economic and overall empowerment. Any Indian citizen with 40% or more disability and age above 18 years can apply for loan under NHFDC scheme for self employment. The age criteria would not be required for educational loans.
NHFDC provides maximum loan upto 50.0 lakh to Persons with disabilities for self-employment activity at the rate of interest 5-9% p.a. (A rebate of 1% in interest will be allowed to women with disabilities/persons with disabilities other than OH in self employment loans of upto Rs.50,000/-).
Application in the prescribed format is to be submitted to the implementing agency for sanction of loan as per procedure and general terms and conditions as laid down, from time to time, by National Handicapped Finance and Development Corporation. Rights of NHFDC : In case of any dispute, decision of the CMD, NHFDC will be final and binding Other Terms and Conditions : Other terms and conditions for the Scheme will be as per the guidelines issued by NHFDC for credit based funding schemes.
Proof of Disability,Domicile Certificate for more references, visit: nhfdc.nic.in
//
Vishesh Microfinance Yojana (VMY) Under this scheme NHFDC provides prompt and need based finance for the target group and activities at reasonable rate of interest through NBFC - MFI, Section-8-MFI, and NGO-MFI, SHG Federations, state Government Missions and other state level \
organizations to pursue small/micro business and development activities. To provide prompt and need based finance for the target group and activities at reasonable rate of interest through NBFC- MFI, Section-8-MFI, and NGO-MFI, SHG Federations, state Government Missions and other state level organizations to pursue small/micro business and developmental activities. Eligibility norms as followed by SIDBI or NABARD from time to time, for such categories of microfinance lending organizations, would be followed. The eligibility norms shall be deliberated and recommended by the Loan Screening Committee of the NHFDC based on the prevailing eligibility norms of the SIDBI or NABARD.
Uniform Interest of 12.50% p.a. be prescribed for all PwDs doing away with gender based interest rate. Correspondingly, the rate of interest for lending by NHFDC would be 4.50% p.a. with margin upto 8.00% for the partner agency. Application in prescribed form attach with necessary documents.Ref website: https://mahabharti.in/yojana/vishesh-microfinance-yojana/ nhfdc.nic.in
Ref website: https://mahabharti.in/yojana/vishesh-microfinance-yojana/ nhfdc.nic.in
// Scheme 5 NHFDC Swavalamban Kendra (NSK) Under this scheme NHFDC provides prompt and need based finance for the target group and activities at reasonable rate of interest through NBFC - MFI, Section-8-MFI, and NGO-MFI, SHG Federations, state Government Missions and other state level \
organizations to pursue small/micro business and development activities. To provide prompt and need based finance for the target group and activities at reasonable rate of interest through NBFC- MFI, Section-8-MFI, and NGO-MFI, SHG Federations, state Government Missions and other state level organizations to pursue small/micro business and developmental activities. Each NSK is established at a capital cost of around Rs. 12 lakhs by PwD entrepreneurs with the help of 100% financing from NHFDC. These NSKs will be used as mini incubation centers with hands on skilling on the locally relevant and viable businesses to train the PwDs for self-employment opportunities in and around their localities.
Uniform Interest of 12.50% p.a. be prescribed for all PwDs doing away with gender based interest rate. Correspondingly, the rate of interest for lending by NHFDC would be 4.50% p.a. with margin upto 8.00% for the partner agency. Application in prescribed form attach with necessary documents.Ref website: https://mahabharti.in/yojana// nhfdc.nic.in
Ref website: https://mahabharti.in/yojana/swavalamban-kendra-yojana/ nhfdc.nic.in
// Loan Scheme Scheme 1
Term Loan /Education Loan /Micro Credit Scheme /Scheme for NGOs /Direct Loan Scheme Physically Disabled
To undertake, carry on, assist to carry on and promote economic development activities including self employment and other ventures for benefit and economic rehabilitation of handicapped persons regardless of their religion, sex, caste and age, in collaboration with State Government Ministries/Departments, extend financial assistance/loans/concessional finance to handicapped persons for implementing economically and financially viable schemes /projects, to grant loans to the handicapped for pursuing education at graduation and higher levels, to assist in up gradation/ improvement of technical and entrepreneurial skills, to set up training, quality control, process development and other infrastructural development activities aimed to achieve economic rehabilitation/upliftment of handicapped persons, to assist other organizations engaged in rehabilitation of the handicapped by providing financial assistance, to assist businesses run by handicapped persons in procuring raw materials and marketing finished goods and to work as an Apex Institution for the State of Maharashtra for channelizing the funds received from State Finance Corporation or the Central Government 1. Applicant should have minimum 40% disability 2. Applicant should be domicile in Maharashtra
This Corporation has given Business Loan to Persons with Disabilities (PWDs) in low interest rate.
Manually Loan form and Disbursement procedure is in process at District level through OBC corporation and online loan procedure is in process after completion then online loan procedure apply.
ID proof
//education through government institute Scheme 1
Special education through government institute
Visually impaired, hearing impaired, orthopedically handicapped Special education is provided to disabled children between age group of 6 to 18 years. 1. Applicant should have minimum 40% disability 2. Applicant should be domicile in Maharashtra
1. Free education 2. Free facilities of food, shelter, clothing
go to the application form and fill
Aadhar Card,Proof of Residence
//Special school for disabled Scheme 2
Special school for disabled
Visually impaired, hearing impaired, orthopedically handicapped Special education is provided to disabled children below the age of 18 years.. 1. Applicant should have minimum 40% disability 2. Applicant should be domicile in Maharashtra
1. Free education 2. Free facilities of food, shelter, clothing
go to the center and fill the required entities with necessary documents
1. Free education 2. Free facilities of food, shelter, clothing
Scheme 3 1 Sahyogi Any Category Disabled This scheme aims at setting up Caregiver Cells (CGCs) to provide training and create a skilled workforce of caregivers to provide adequate and nurturing care for Person with Disabilities (PwD) and their families who require it.It also seeks to provide parents an opportunity to get trained in caregiving if they so desire. This scheme will provide a choice of training through two levels of courses to allow it to create caregivers suited to work both with families of persons with Disabilities (PwDs) and other institutions catering to the needs of the PwDs (NGOs, work centres etc.)..
Primary Training 1. Applicant age should be between 18-35 years at the time of applying for the training 2. The applicant must be minimum 8th standard or equivalent pass Advanced Training 1. Applicant age should be between 18-35 years at the time of applying for the training 2. The applicant must be: ¾ Minimum 8th class pass or equivalent and should have completed the primary training/previous Sahyogi course/RCI primary training course OR ¾ Minimum 10th class pass or equivalent
1. Free education 2. Free facilities of food, shelter, clothing
go to the portal and register yourself and inquire
Proof of residence,Valid Identity proof
Scheme 1
Homes for intellectually impaired person
Mentally disabled children who are in need of care and protection Provide home to children with disability 1. Applicant should have minimum 40% disability 2. Applicant should be domicile in Maharashtra
Free facility of food shelter and care and protection are provided in these homes

disability proof
Scheme 1
Matrimonialincentives 1. Either wife or husband of the couple should be disabled 2. Applicant should have minimum 40% disability 3. Applicant should be domicile in Maharashtra
. Disable person with at least 40% of disability if getting he/ she get married with non-disabled person he/ she will get marriage incentive
₹50,000 in total 1. Saving certificate of ₹25,000 2. ₹20,000 in cash 3. ₹4500 in form of household utilities 4. ₹500 to attend marriage program
Age proof

Scheme 1
Indira Gandhi National Pension Scheme Visually impaired, hearing impaired, orthopedically handicapped
All category disabled person Pension scheme Under the schema ₹600 per month is given to each beneficiary
A disable person in age of 18265 years and having 80% disability is eligible under the schem 1.Under the schema ₹600 per month is given to each beneficiary a. He or she is entitled to receive ₹200 per month under the scheme. He or she also receive ₹400 per month under state sponsored Sanjay Gandhi niradhar anudan yojna
